str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To long for, covet, lust after, set the heart upon. From epi and thumos; to set the heart upon, i.e. Long for.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To resist, oppose, withstand, lie opposite to. From anti and keimai; to lie opposite, i.e. Be adverse to.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
